attributes.comment:
Now I know the government has no intention of easing the problem of illegal
immigration. I fully support the right of immigrants to better their lives, but it is sad
that it is so difficult for them to become citizens and for most people, it is
hopeless. Many immigrants come to this country because their own is so poverty-
stricken that they would rather clean houses or perform day labor than try to earn
a living in their home countries. And since the legal avenues of becoming citizens
are largely unavailable to the poor who cannot pay the fees, speak English or
perhaps even read in any language, they are forced to endanger their lives by
crossing the desert on foot just to make minimum wage. How can they possibly
hope to ever raise $1000 when they are killing themselves to make $5.00/hour or
less? This is only going to put citizenship out of reach for more individuals, thus
raising the possibility that more immigrants will cross the border illegally and
unsafely.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Adrienne
